title: Scottish Labour MPs should be whipped in Gaza ceasefire vote – SNP
description: The SNP is calling on Scottish Labour to whip its two MPs to vote for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza, ahead of a vote in the House of Commons next week. On Saturday, Scottish Labour’s conference is expected to pass a motion calling for an immediate ceasefire in the conflict.

title: ‘Come together’ Sunak tells Conservatives after twin by-election blow
description: Rishi Sunak has called on British conservatives to ‘come together’, after a bruising set of by-election defeats in Wellingborough and Kingswood.

title: Donald Trump fined 364 million dollars in civil fraud case

title: Democrats relieved as Manchin rules out White House bid
description: Democrats were concerned that an independent bid could help deliver the White House to the Republicans in November's election. Mr Manchin finally ended the speculation on Friday, and seemed to acknowledge that the prospect of such unintended consequences was a factor in his decision not to run.

title: Biden 'contemplating' steps to punish Moscow as world leaders blame 'monster' Putin for Navalny's death
description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has described Mr Navalny as the "fiercest advocate for Russian democracy", while French President Emmanuel Macron said his death shows the "weakness of the Kremlin and their fear of all opponents".

title: Lockdown backers to blame for UK recession, suggests minister
description: The Government’s “minister for common sense” has appeared to blame “everybody who voted for lockdown” for the British economy’s dip into recession. Cabinet Office Minister Esther McVey made the claim during an appearance on BBC Radio 4’s Any Questions, as she faced questions about who voters should hold responsible for the lack of growth.

title: By-elections: Tory gloom deepens after double poll blow
description: And in Kingswood, near Bristol, they got a share of the vote greater than the gap between the victorious Labour candidate and the Tory runner-up. That is a double dose of the heebie-jeebies delivered in one day to nervous Tories.

title: Could Reform UK surge sink Tory election hopes?
description: Reform UK leader Richard Tice has said he wants to "smash" and "destroy" the Tory Party at the general election. He insisted Reform UK would never consider repeating the Brexit Party's 2019 deal with the Conservatives - which saw it withdraw candidates in 317 constituencies after then-Tory leader Boris Johnson committed to leaving the EU by 2020.
